result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher R. Waters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher R. Waters is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher R. Waters was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.  
Not to unlawfully operate a motor vehicle.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Chris Rose.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 10 yrs WSP; initial confinement of 4yrs followed by 6 yrs of ES.  See ES conditions.  Credit for 94 days.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Appeal rights.  Voting acknowledgment.  Firearm warning given.  Bond shall be applied towards costs - balance may be returned to poster.
WCS - Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Supervision Status Report

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Chris Rose.  Deft has been compliant w/Chapter 85.  Defense request an adjournment to January; deft should be completed with his counseling in January.  Deft's request for adjournment is denied for the reasons set forth on the record.  Court takes a short recess to allow Atty Rose to complete the plea questionnaire.  Court reconvenes.  Case is settled.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 12/3/14 @ 11am.  Bond is revoked.  Deft taken into custody.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.
WCS - Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Supervision Status Report

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Christopher Rose.  Defense requests an adjournment in order for the deft to complete Chapter 85 counseling.  Court denies the request.  FPT 10/6/14 @ 1:45pm, JT 10/27/14 @ 9am.  Defense moves for modification of bond - lift no contact order (victim present).  State objects.  Court denies the deft's request for bond modification.
WCS - Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Supervision Status Report
Final pre-trial on August 21, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Due to ongoing jury trial (State v. Martinez), 6/25/2014 Final pre-trial is rescheduled to 8/21/2014 at 10am.  NTBS by the Court.
